website_summaries.verdict: A relatively inexpensive kit that offers directions and all the materials you need to start brewing kombucha.
pros: Comes with SCOBY that grows quickly
Tools for brewing include pH strips for testing the culture and a gauge to make sure brew is at the right temperature
cons: Includes small amounts of ingredients and won't make many batches before you need to buy more

customer_reviews.title: Easy kit for getting started brewing kombucha
customer_reviews.text: Great kit! Definitely makes brewing kombucha easy. I've previously owned two kits--one complete kit, similar to this from The Kombucha Shop, and one I threw together myself. I stopped brewing kombucha a couple years ago when I got a really moldy batch, and it grossed me out so badly that I couldn't do it for awhile/I had to throw away my Scoby. I'm ready to try again, and this kit is perfect for someone starting up (or starting over!). It comes with everything you need- a healthy Scoby, sugar, tea, a jar, and other "accessories" to make your brewing complete. I can't wait to see how my kombucha turns out!
customer_reviews.author: Dani Arteri

customer_reviews.title: Great kickoff for those who don't know what to do
customer_reviews.text: My wife is a self-professed Kombucha nut. She likes drinking the ready-made stuff from the store, but has always been interested in making her own. In fact, she had made her OWN brews in the past, so she was very curious to see how a ready-made kit would work out. She gives the product full marks - it has the necessary components that you need to brew your own Kombucha and you'll learn how to make your own from this point forward!

customer_reviews.title: Complete starter kit
customer_reviews.text: This is a complete kit right down to the cloth to cover the jar to keep the fruit flies out. It has enough tea leaves for at least two batches of Kombucha, and the scobi will grow and multiply if kept well. It is important to remember to open the box right away and tend to the scoby as this is a living culture that cannot tolerate extreme heat and being bagged in a oxygen-deprived pouch for long. It has to breathe, and it needs to be fed. The box might be a bit pricey, but buying everything separately isn't exactly cheap either, and it is good to have a guarantee that you get a fresh scoby.
customer_reviews.author: Condor

customer_reviews.title: A complete kit except bottles for drinking
customer_reviews.text: This kit has everything except bottles for the kombucha making. I tried it and it just couldn't be easier. I recommended it to my bff and she got one too, none of us have had kombucha before so it was a good introduction. The instructions were easy peasy and everything even the sugar was included. It's even a good introduction into maybe making other fermented beverages. It's warm here so the activity was quick and now I'm drinking them. I have not tasted kombucha before so I can't review on the taste, but my trials have been sweet/vinegary with a little kick.
customer_reviews.author: Rowan

customer_reviews.title: quality setup but the scoby was a non starter
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try out this kit and to be able to make kombucha rather than buying it from the grocery store. It’s well thought out and ally he components are good quality. I set everything up according to the instructions but no results. I’m guessing the fact that we live in a rural area and have to pick up our mail once a week from a post office where it is stored in a non climate controlled area coupled with a heat wave left the scoby unable to do what it needs to. I’m hanging on to the kit and waiting for a friend to share her scoby once it grows.
customer_reviews.author: Liz
